    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import axios from 'axios'; import './MemberList.css'; const MemberCard = ({ member, onDeleteMember, onUpdateMember }) => { const [isEditing, setIsEditing] = useState(false); const [updatedName, setUpdatedName] = useState(member.name); const [updatedAmountDue, setUpdatedAmountDue] = useState(member.amountdue); const [transactions, setTransactions] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { fetchTransactions(); }, []); const fetchTransactions = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/transactions/'); const memberTransactions = response.data.filter( transaction => transaction.member === member.id ); // Fetch book details for each transaction const transactionsWithBookNames = await Promise.all(memberTransactions.map(async transaction => { const bookResponse = await axios.get(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${transaction.book}/`); return { ...transaction, book_name: bookResponse.data.title // Assuming your book model has a "title" field }; })); setTransactions(transactionsWithBookNames); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching transactions:', error); } }; const handleUpdateClick = () => { setIsEditing(true); }; const handleCancelUpdate = () => { setIsEditing(false); setUpdatedName(member.name); setUpdatedAmountDue(member.amountdue); }; const handleUpdate = () => { onUpdateMember({ ...member, name: updatedName, amountdue: updatedAmountDue }); setIsEditing(false); }; const handleReturnBook = async (transactionId) => { const returnDate = new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 10); // Today's date try { const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/return-book/', { transaction_id: transactionId, return_date: returnDate, }); // Update the transactions after returning the book fetchTransactions(); } catch (error) { console.error('Error returning book:', error); } }; return ( <div> <h3> {isEditing ? ( <input type="text" value={updatedName} onChange={(e) => setUpdatedName(e.target.value)} /> ) : ( member.name )} </h3> <p> Amount Due: {isEditing ? ( <input type="number" value={updatedAmountDue} onChange={(e) => setUpdatedAmountDue(e.target.value)} /> ) : ( member.amountdue )} </p> <div> {isEditing ? ( <div> <button onClick={handleUpdate}>Save</button> <button onClick={handleCancelUpdate}>Cancel</button> </div> ) : ( <div> <button onClick={handleUpdateClick}>Update</button> <button onClick={() => onDeleteMember(member.id)}>Delete</button> </div> )} </div> <div> <h4>Books Issued and Transactions:</h4> {transactions.length > 0 ? ( <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Book Name</th> <th>Issue Date</th> <th>Return Date</th> <th>Actions</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> {transactions.map(transaction => ( <tr key={transaction.id}> <td>{transaction.book_name}</td> <td>{transaction.issue_date}</td> <td> {transaction.return_date || 'Not returned'} </td> <td> {!transaction.return_date && ( <button onClick={() => handleReturnBook(transaction.id)}> Return Book </button> )} </td> </tr> ))} </tbody> </table> ) : ( <p>No books issued</p> )} </div> </div> ); }; const MemberList = () => { const [members, setMembers] = useState([]); const [newMemberName, setNewMemberName] = useState(''); const [newMemberAmountDue, setNewMemberAmountDue] = useState(''); useEffect(() => { fetchMembers(); }, []); const fetchMembers = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/'); const membersWithIssuedBooks = await Promise.all(response.data.map(async member => { const issuedBooksResponse = await Promise.all(member.books_issued.map(async bookId => { const bookResponse = await axios.get(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`); return bookResponse.data; })); return { ...member, issuedBooks: issuedBooksResponse }; })); setMembers(membersWithIssuedBooks); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching members:', error); } }; const deleteMember = async (memberId) => { try { await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/${memberId}/`); fetchMembers(); } catch (error) { console.error('Error deleting member:', error); } }; const updateMember = async (updatedMember) => { try { await axios.put( `https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/${updatedMember.id}/`, updatedMember ); fetchMembers(); } catch (error) { console.error('Error updating member:', error); } }; const addMember = async () => { try { await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/', { name: newMemberName, amountdue: newMemberAmountDue, }); fetchMembers(); setNewMemberName(''); setNewMemberAmountDue(''); } catch (error) { console.error('Error adding member:', error); } }; return ( <div> <div> <h2>Add New Member</h2> <div> <input type="text" placeholder="Name" value={newMemberName} onChange={(e) => setNewMemberName(e.target.value)} /> <input type="number" placeholder="Amount Due" value={newMemberAmountDue} onChange={(e) => setNewMemberAmountDue(e.target.value)} /> <button onClick={addMember}>Add</button> </div> </div> <div> {members.map(member => ( <MemberCard key={member.id} member={member} onDeleteMember={deleteMember} onUpdateMember={updateMember} /> ))} </div> </div> ); }; export default MemberList;

    The code you provided appears to be a React application for managing a list of library members and their transactions. The application allows you to add, update, and delete members, as well as issue and return books. It uses Axios for making API requests and manages state using React's useState and useEffect hooks.

    Here's a breakdown of the main components and functionalities in the code:

    1. MemberCard Component: This component is responsible for displaying the details of an individual member, including their name, amount due, and a list of books issued to them. It also provides buttons for updating the member's details and deleting the member. The handleReturnBook function is used to mark a book as returned.

    2. MemberList Component: This is the main component that renders the list of all members. It uses the MemberCard component to display each member's information. This component also includes the ability to add new members using the addMember function. It fetches the list of members from an API and renders them using the map function.

    3. State Management: The useState hook is used throughout the code to manage state. States like isEditing, updatedName, updatedAmountDue, transactions, members, newMemberName, and newMemberAmountDue hold various pieces of information.

    If the MemberList.css file is not working as expected, here are a few steps you can take to troubleshoot and ensure that the CSS styling is applied to your React components:

    1. Check File Path: Make sure that the path to the MemberList.css file is correct. The CSS file should be in the same directory as your React components or in a subdirectory that matches the import path you have provided in the code.

    2. Check CSS Syntax: Ensure that the CSS syntax in the MemberList.css file is correct and error-free. Even a small syntax error could prevent the styles from being applied. You can also try adding simple styles like changing the background color to verify that the CSS file is being loaded.

    3. Check Import Statement: Double-check that the import statement at the top of your MemberList.js file matches the actual path to the MemberList.css file. It should look something like this:

      jsx
      import './MemberList.css';

    4. Inspect Elements: Use your browser's developer tools to inspect the elements rendered by your React components. Check if the CSS classes defined in your MemberList.css are correctly applied to the elements. If they are not applied, it could indicate an issue with the import or the CSS itself.

    5. Cache Issues: Sometimes, caching issues can cause styles to not update as expected. Clear your browser cache and try reloading the page.

    6. Console Errors: Check your browser's console for any errors related to loading the CSS file. If there are errors, they might provide clues about what's going wrong.

    7. Live Server or Build: If you're using a live development server (e.g., through Create React App) or you're building your React application for production, ensure that the CSS file is being included and served correctly.

    8. Check Dependencies: Sometimes, dependency version mismatches or conflicts can cause unexpected behavior. Make sure that your React and related libraries are up to date.

    9. Fallback Styles: As a temporary measure, you could add inline styles directly within your components to ensure that some styling is applied. This can help you determine if the issue is with the CSS file itself or with how it's being imported.

    10. Try Different Styles: If none of the above solutions work, try using a different set of styles or CSS rules to see if they are applied. This can help isolate whether the issue is specific to your MemberList.css file.

    By following these steps, you should be able to identify the cause of the issue and get your MemberList.css styles working correctly with your React components.

    It seems like you want to extract the Tailwind CSS classes used in your code into a separate CSS file. You can do this by creating a separate CSS file and moving the Tailwind classes from your JSX code to the CSS file. Here's how you can do it:

    1. Create a new CSS file in the same directory as your MemberList.js and MemberCard.js files. You can name it something like styles.css.

    2. In the new styles.css file, add the Tailwind classes that you were using in your JSX code. For example:

    css
    /* styles.css */

/* Buttons */
.bg-green-500 {
  background-color: #48bb78;
}
.text-white {
  color: #fff;
}
.py-2 {
  padding-top: 0.5rem;
  padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
}
.px-4 {
  padding-left: 1rem;
  padding-right: 1rem;
}
...

/* Other classes */
/* Define any other Tailwind classes you're using */
    1. In your MemberList.js and MemberCard.js files, remove the inline style attributes and replace them with class names from your styles.css file. For example:
    jsx
    <button className="bg-green-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-green-600 ml-2" onClick={addMember}>
  Add
</button>

    becomes:

    jsx
    <button className="my-custom-button-class" onClick={addMember}>
  Add
</button>

    1. In your components, you can now add the custom class names that you defined in your styles.css file.

    2. In your JSX, replace the inline style attributes with the class names you defined in your styles.css file.

    By following these steps, you'll be able to separate your styling concerns and make your code cleaner and more maintainable. Remember that you need to link the styles.css file to your HTML (or use a bundler like Webpack) so that the styles are applied to your components.

    To move the "Update" and "Delete" buttons to the right side of the MemberCard component, you can modify the structure of the JSX code within the div containing these buttons. Here's the updated code with the buttons on the right side:

    jsx
    // ... (other imports and code)

const MemberCard = ({ member, onDeleteMember, onUpdateMember }) => {
  // ... (existing code)

  return (
    <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md p-6 mb-4">
      {/* ... (existing code) */}

      <div className="mt-4 flex justify-end">
        {isEditing ? (
          <div>
            <button
              className="bg-green-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-green-600"
              onClick={handleUpdate}
            >
              Save
            </button>
            <button
              className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600 ml-2"
              onClick={handleCancelUpdate}
            >
              Cancel
            </button>
          </div>
        ) : (
          <div>
            <button
              className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 mr-2"
              onClick={handleUpdateClick}
            >
              Update
            </button>
            <button
              className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600"
              onClick={() => onDeleteMember(member.id)}
            >
              Delete
            </button>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* ... (remaining code) */}
    </div>
  );
};

// ... (remaining code)

    In the code above, I've added the flex justify-end classes to the div wrapping the buttons. This uses Flexbox to align the buttons to the right side of the container. As a result, the "Update" and "Delete" buttons will now appear on the right side of the member card.

    By adding the justify-end class to the wrapping div, you effectively move the buttons to the opposite side of where they were originally placed.

    jsx
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

const MemberCard = ({ member, onDeleteMember, onUpdateMember }) => {
  const [isEditing, setIsEditing] = useState(false);
  const [updatedName, setUpdatedName] = useState(member.name);
  const [updatedAmountDue, setUpdatedAmountDue] = useState(member.amountdue);
  const [transactions, setTransactions] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchTransactions();
  }, []);

  // ... (rest of the existing code)

  return (
    <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md p-6 mb-4">
      <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-2">
        {isEditing ? (
          <input
            type="text"
            value={updatedName}
            onChange={(e) => setUpdatedName(e.target.value)}
            style={{ outline: '2px solid blue' }}
          />
        ) : (
          member.name
        )}
      </h3>
      <p className="text-gray-600">Amount Due: 
        {isEditing ? (
          <input
            type="number"
            value={updatedAmountDue}
            onChange={(e) => setUpdatedAmountDue(e.target.value)}
            style={{ outline: '2px solid blue' }}
          />
        ) : (
          member.amountdue
        )}
      </p>
      <div className="mt-4 flex justify-end">
        {isEditing ? (
          <div>
            <button
              className="bg-green-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-green-600"
              onClick={handleUpdate}
            >
              Save
            </button>
            <button
              className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600 ml-2"
              onClick={handleCancelUpdate}
            >
              Cancel
            </button>
          </div>
        ) : (
          <div>
            <button
              className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 mr-2"
              onClick={handleUpdateClick}
            >
              Update
            </button>
            <button
              className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600"
              onClick={() => onDeleteMember(member.id)}
            >
              Delete
            </button>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
      <div className="mt-4">
        <h4 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">Books Issued and Transactions:</h4>
        {transactions.length > 0 ? (
          <table className="table-auto w-full">
            {/* ... (rest of the table code) */}
          </table>
        ) : (
          <p>No books issued</p>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

  // ... (rest of the existing code)
};

export default MemberList;

    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import axios from 'axios'; import './BookList.css'; // Import your custom CSS file const BookList = () => { const [books, setBooks] = useState([]); const [selectedBook, setSelectedBook] = useState(null); const [selectedMember, setSelectedMember] = useState(''); const [members, setMembers] = useState([]); const [isIssuingModalOpen, setIsIssuingModalOpen] = useState(false); const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState(''); useEffect(() => { fetchBooks(); fetchMembers(); }, []); const fetchBooks = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/'); setBooks(response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching books:', error); } }; const fetchMembers = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/'); setMembers(response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching members:', error); } }; const handleSearch = () => { if (searchQuery.trim() === '') { fetchBooks(); // Reset the list if the search query is empty } else { const filteredBooks = books.filter(book => book.title.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase()) || book.authors.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase()) ); setBooks(filteredBooks); } }; const openIssuingModal = (book) => { setSelectedBook(book); setSelectedMember(''); setIsIssuingModalOpen(true); }; const closeIssuingModal = () => { setSelectedBook(null); setSelectedMember(''); setIsIssuingModalOpen(false); }; const handleIssuing = async () => { try { const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/issue-book/', { book: selectedBook.id, member: selectedMember, issue_date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0], }); closeIssuingModal(); fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list } catch (error) { console.error('Error issuing book:', error); } }; const handleDeleteBook = async (bookId) => { try { await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`); fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list } catch (error) { console.error('Error deleting book:', error); } }; return ( <div className="container py-4"> <div className="mb-4 search-bar"> <div className="input-group"> <input type="text" placeholder="Search by title or author" className="form-control search-input" value={searchQuery} onChange={e => setSearchQuery(e.target.value)} /> <div className="input-group-append"> <button className="btn btn-primary search-button" onClick={handleSearch} > Search </button> </div> </div> </div> <div className="row row-cols-1 row-cols-md-2 row-cols-lg-3 g-4"> {books.map(book => ( <div key={book.id} className="col"> <div className="card"> <div className="card-body"> <h3 className="card-title">{book.title}</h3> <p className="card-text">Author: {book.authors}</p> <p className="card-text">ISBN: {book.isbn}</p> <p className="card-text">Average Rating: {book.average_rating}</p> <button className="btn btn-lg btn-primary mb-2" onClick={() => openIssuingModal(book)} > Issue Book </button> <br /> <button className="btn btn-lg btn-danger" onClick={() => handleDeleteBook(book.id)} > Delete Book </button> </div> </div> </div> ))} </div> {isIssuingModalOpen && ( <div className="modal-backdrop"> <div className="modal-dialog"> <div className="modal-content"> {/* ... (modal content) ... */} </div> </div> </div> )} </div> ); }; export default BookList; do card container baground color black and font color to white

    I apologize for the misunderstanding. To set the background color of the entire page to black and the font color to white, you can apply CSS styles to the top-level container of the BookList component. Here's how you can do it:

    1. Open your BookList.css file.

    2. Add the following styles to set the background color to black and the font color to white for the entire page:

    css
    body {
  background-color: black;
  color: white;
}

    Your BookList.css file should now look like this:

    css
    body {
  background-color: black;
  color: white;
}

/* Add any other custom styles you need */

    By adding these styles to the body element, you'll achieve the desired effect of having a black background and white font color for the entire page, including the content inside the card containers.

    Sure! To place the two buttons (Issue Book and Delete Book) on the right side within the card body, you can use the Bootstrap classes d-flex (flex container) and justify-content-end (justify content to the end, i.e., right side). Here's the updated code with the buttons on the right side:

    jsx
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';
import './BookList.css'; // Import your custom CSS file

const BookList = () => {
  // ... (rest of your code)

  return (
    <div className="container py-4">
      <div className="mb-4 search-bar">
        <div className="input-group">
          {/* ... (search input and button) ... */}
        </div>
      </div>

      <div className="row row-cols-1 row-cols-md-2 row-cols-lg-3 g-4">
        {books.map(book => (
          <div key={book.id} className="col">
            <div className="card">
              <div className="card-body d-flex justify-content-between"> {/* Flex container with right justification */}
                <div>
                  <h3 className="card-title">{book.title}</h3>
                  <p className="card-text">Author: {book.authors}</p>
                  <p className="card-text">ISBN: {book.isbn}</p>
                  <p className="card-text">Average Rating: {book.average_rating}</p>
                </div>
                <div>
                  <button
                    className="btn btn-lg btn-primary mb-2"
                    onClick={() => openIssuingModal(book)}
                  >
                    Issue Book
                  </button>
                  <br />
                  <button
                    className="btn btn-lg btn-danger"
                    onClick={() => handleDeleteBook(book.id)}
                  >
                    Delete Book
                  </button>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* ... (issuing modal) ... */}
    </div>
  );
};

export default BookList;

    By using the d-flex justify-content-between classes within the card-body div, you're creating a flex container with the content evenly distributed between the start (left side) and end (right side). This will place the two buttons on the right side of the card body for each book card in the list.

    To set the background color of the card container to black, you can add a custom class to the card element and set its background color in your CSS file. Here's how you can do it:

    1. Add a custom CSS class for the card container background color:
    css
    /* BookList.css */
.card-black {
  background-color: black;
  color: white; /* Set text color to white for better visibility */
}
    1. Apply the custom class to the card element in the JSX code:
    jsx
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';
import './BookList.css'; // Import your custom CSS file

const BookList = () => {
  // ... (rest of your code)

  return (
    <div className="container py-4">
      {/* ... (search bar code) ... */}

      <div className="row row-cols-1 row-cols-md-2 row-cols-lg-3 g-4">
        {books.map(book => (
          <div key={book.id} className="col">
            <div className="card card-black"> {/* Apply custom class for the card */}
              <div className="card-body">
                <h3 className="card-title">{book.title}</h3>
                <p className="card-text">Author: {book.authors}</p>
                <p className="card-text">ISBN: {book.isbn}</p>
                <p className="card-text">Average Rating: {book.average_rating}</p>
                <button
                  className="btn btn-lg btn-primary mb-2"
                  onClick={() => openIssuingModal(book)}
                >
                  Issue Book
                </button>
                <br />
                <button
                  className="btn btn-lg btn-danger"
                  onClick={() => handleDeleteBook(book.id)}
                >
                  Delete Book
                </button>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* ... (issuing modal) ... */}
    </div>
  );
};

export default BookList;

    By adding the card-black class to the card element, you're applying the custom background color and text color to the card container. Don't forget to ensure that your BookList.css file is properly linked and loaded in your application.

    Certainly! I've enhanced the styling of the BookList component to make it more colorful and attractive. Here's the updated code:

    jsx
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

const BookList = () => {
  const [books, setBooks] = useState([]);
  const [selectedBook, setSelectedBook] = useState(null);
  const [selectedMember, setSelectedMember] = useState('');
  const [members, setMembers] = useState([]);
  const [isIssuingModalOpen, setIsIssuingModalOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBooks();
    fetchMembers();
  }, []);

  const fetchBooks = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/');
      setBooks(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching books:', error);
    }
  };

  const fetchMembers = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/');
      setMembers(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching members:', error);
    }
  };

  const openIssuingModal = (book) => {
    setSelectedBook(book);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(true);
  };

  const closeIssuingModal = () => {
    setSelectedBook(null);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(false);
  };

  const handleIssuing = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/issue-book/', {
        book: selectedBook.id,
        member: selectedMember,
        issue_date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
      });
      closeIssuingModal();
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error issuing book:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleDeleteBook = async (bookId) => {
    try {
      await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`);
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error deleting book:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="p-4">
      {/* Search Bar */}
      <div className="mb-4">
        {/* ... (search input and button) ... */}
      </div>

      {/* Render book cards */}
      <div className="grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 gap-4">
        {books.map(book => (
          <div key={book.id} className="bg-white p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md border border-gray-300">
            <h3 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2 text-indigo-600">{book.title}</h3>
            <p className="text-gray-600">Author: {book.authors}</p>
            <p className="text-gray-600">ISBN: {book.isbn}</p>
            <p className="text-gray-600">Average Rating: {book.average_rating}</p>
            <div className="flex justify-between mt-4">
              <button
                className="bg-indigo-600 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-indigo-700"
                onClick={() => openIssuingModal(book)}
              >
                Issue Book
              </button>
              <button
                className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600"
                onClick={() => handleDeleteBook(book.id)}
              >
                Delete Book
              </button>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* Issuing Modal */}
      {isIssuingModalOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex items-center justify-center bg-black bg-opacity-50">
          <div className="bg-white p-4 rounded-lg">
            <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4 text-indigo-600">Issue/Edit Book</h2>
            {/* ... (rest of the modal content) ... */}
          </div>
        </div>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default BookList;

    I've used more vibrant colors for buttons and headings, added some borders and spacing for a polished look, and aligned the buttons using the justify-between class. You can adjust the colors and styles further according to your design preferences.

const BookList = () => {

  const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBooks();
    fetchMembers();
  }, []);

  const fetchBooks = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/');
      setBooks(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching books:', error);
    }
  };

  const fetchMembers = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/');
      setMembers(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching members:', error);
    }
  };

  const openIssuingModal = (book) => {
    setSelectedBook(book);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(true);
  };

  const closeIssuingModal = () => {
    setSelectedBook(null);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(false);
  };

  const handleIssuing = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/issue-book/', {
        book: selectedBook.id,
        member: selectedMember,
        issue_date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
      });
      closeIssuingModal();
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error issuing book:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleDeleteBook = async (bookId) => {
    try {
      await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`);
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error deleting book:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="p-4">
      {/* Search Bar */}

        {/* ... (search input and button) ... */}
      </div>

      {/* Render book cards */}

              <span className="text-gray-600">{book.isbn}</span>
            </div>
            <p className="text-gray-600">Author: {book.authors}</p>
            <p className="text-gray-600">Average Rating: {book.average_rating}</p>
            <div className="flex justify-between mt-4">
              <button
                className="bg-indigo-600 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-indigo-700"
                onClick={() => openIssuingModal(book)}

                className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600"

    1 / 1
    write the fulll code
    1 / 1

    Certainly! Here's the full code for the BookList component with the changes you requested:

    jsx
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

const BookList = () => {
  const [books, setBooks] = useState([]);
  const [selectedBook, setSelectedBook] = useState(null);
  const [selectedMember, setSelectedMember] = useState('');
  const [members, setMembers] = useState([]);
  const [isIssuingModalOpen, setIsIssuingModalOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBooks();
    fetchMembers();
  }, []);

  const fetchBooks = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/');
      setBooks(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching books:', error);
    }
  };

  const fetchMembers = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/');
      setMembers(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching members:', error);
    }
  };

  const openIssuingModal = (book) => {
    setSelectedBook(book);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(true);
  };

  const closeIssuingModal = () => {
    setSelectedBook(null);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(false);
  };

  const handleIssuing = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/issue-book/', {
        book: selectedBook.id,
        member: selectedMember,
        issue_date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
      });
      closeIssuingModal();
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error issuing book:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleDeleteBook = async (bookId) => {
    try {
      await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`);
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error deleting book:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleSearch = () => {
    if (searchQuery.trim() === '') {
      fetchBooks(); // Reset the list if the search query is empty
    } else {
      const filteredBooks = books.filter(book =>
        book.title.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase()) ||
        book.authors.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase())
      );
      setBooks(filteredBooks);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="p-4">
      {/* Search Bar */}
      <div className="mb-4">
        <input
          type="text"
          placeholder="Search by title or author"
          className="border rounded w-full p-2"
          value={searchQuery}
          onChange={e => setSearchQuery(e.target.value)}
        />
        <button
          className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900600 ml-2 mt-3"
          onClick={handleSearch}
        >
          Search
        </button>
      </div>

      {/* Render book cards */}
      <div className="grid gap-4">
        {books.map(book => (
          <div key={book.id} className="bg-white p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md border border-gray-300">
            <h3 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">{book.title}</h3>
            <p className="text-gray-600">Author: {book.authors}</p>
            <p className="text-gray-600">ISBN: {book.isbn}</p>
            <p className="text-gray-600">Average Rating: {book.average_rating}</p>
            <button
              className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 mt-2 mr-3"
              onClick={() => openIssuingModal(book)}
            >
              Issue Book
            </button>
            <button
              className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600 mt-2"
              onClick={() => handleDeleteBook(book.id)}
            >
              Delete Book
            </button>
          </div>
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* Issuing Modal */}
      {isIssuingModalOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex items-center justify-center bg-black bg-opacity-50">
          <div className="bg-white p-4 rounded-lg">
            <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4 text-indigo-600">Issue/Edit Book</h2>
            <label className="block mb-2">
              Member:
              <select
                className="border rounded w-full p-2"
                value={selectedMember}
                onChange={e => setSelectedMember(e.target.value)}
              >
                <option value="">Select a member</option>
                {members.map(member => (
                  <option key={member.id} value={member.id}>{member.name}</option>
                ))}
              </select>
            </label>
            <div className="flex justify-end mt-4">
              <button
                className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 mr-2"
                onClick={handleIssuing}
                disabled={!selectedMember}
              >
                Save
              </button>
              <button
                className="bg-gray-300 text-gray-700 py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-gray-400"
                onClick={closeIssuingModal}
              >
                Cancel
              </button>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default BookList;

    This code should display book cards in a single column and implement the style changes you've requested. Make sure to adjust the styles as needed to match your design preferences.

    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import axios from 'axios'; import './BookList.css'; // Import your custom CSS file const BookList = () => { const [books, setBooks] = useState([]);             <div className="modal-content">
              {/* ... (modal content) ... */}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

    Certainly, I've updated the code to set the background of the form to black. Here's the modified code:

    jsx
    import React, { useState } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

const BookForm = () => {
  const [memberId, setMemberId] = useState('');
  const [issueDate, setIssueDate] = useState(new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]);

  const handleIssue = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/issue-book/', {
        book: 123,  // Replace with appropriate book ID
        member: memberId,
        issue_date: issueDate,
      });
      console.log('Book issued:', response.data);
      // Reset form
      setMemberId('');
      setIssueDate(new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error issuing book:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-black rounded-lg shadow-md p-6 text-white"> {/* Set background color to black and text color to white */}
      <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4">Issue Book</h2>
      <label className="block mb-2">
        Member ID:
        <input
          type="number"
          className="border rounded w-full p-2"
          value={memberId}
          onChange={e => setMemberId(e.target.value)}
        />
      </label>
      <label className="block mb-2">
        Issue Date:
        <input
          type="date"
          className="border rounded w-full p-2"
          value={issueDate}
          onChange={e => setIssueDate(e.target.value)}
        />
      </label>
      <button
        className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900"
        onClick={handleIssue}
      >
        Issue
      </button>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BookForm;

    Now the background of the form is set to black and the text color is white.

    1 / 1

    Certainly! Here's the modified code with the background color of the cards set to dark blue:

    jsx
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

const BookList = () => {
  const [books, setBooks] = useState([]);
  const [selectedBook, setSelectedBook] = useState(null);
  const [selectedMember, setSelectedMember] = useState('');
  const [members, setMembers] = useState([]);
  const [isIssuingModalOpen, setIsIssuingModalOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBooks();
    fetchMembers();
  }, []);

  const fetchBooks = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/');
      setBooks(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching books:', error);
    }
  };

  const fetchMembers = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/');
      setMembers(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching members:', error);
    }
  };

  const openIssuingModal = (book) => {
    setSelectedBook(book);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(true);
  };

  const closeIssuingModal = () => {
    setSelectedBook(null);
    setSelectedMember('');
    setIsIssuingModalOpen(false);
  };

  const handleIssuing = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/issue-book/', {
        book: selectedBook.id,
        member: selectedMember,
        issue_date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
      });
      closeIssuingModal();
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error issuing book:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleDeleteBook = async (bookId) => {
    try {
      await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`);
      fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error deleting book:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleSearch = () => {
    if (searchQuery.trim() === '') {
      fetchBooks(); // Reset the list if the search query is empty
    } else {
      const filteredBooks = books.filter(book =>
        book.title.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase()) ||
        book.authors.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase())
      );
      setBooks(filteredBooks);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="p-4">
      {/* Search Bar */}
      <div className="mb-4">
        <input
          type="text"
          placeholder="Search by title or author"
          className="border rounded w-full p-2"
          value={searchQuery}
          onChange={e => setSearchQuery(e.target.value)}
        />
        <button
          className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900600 ml-2 mt-3"
          onClick={handleSearch}
        >
          Search
        </button>
      </div>

      {/* Render book cards */}
      <div className="grid gap-4">
        {books.map(book => (
          <div key={book.id} className="bg-blue-900 p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md border border-gray-300 text-white">
            <h3 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">{book.title}</h3>
            <p className="text-gray-400">Author: {book.authors}</p>
            <p className="text-gray-400">ISBN: {book.isbn}</p>
            <p className="text-gray-400">Average Rating: {book.average_rating}</p>
            <div className="flex justify-between items-center mt-4">
              <button
                className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900"
                onClick={() => openIssuingModal(book)}
              >
                Issue Book
              </button>
              <button
                className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600"
                onClick={() => handleDeleteBook(book.id)}
              >
                Delete Book
              </button>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* Issuing Modal */}
      {isIssuingModalOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex items-center justify-center bg-black bg-opacity-50">
          <div className="bg-white p-4 rounded-lg">
            <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4 text-indigo-600">Issue/Edit Book</h2>
            <label className="block mb-2">
              Member:
              <select
                className="border rounded w-full p-2"
                value={selectedMember}
                onChange={e => setSelectedMember(e.target.value)}
              >
                <option value="">Select a member</option>
                {members.map(member => (
                  <option key={member.id} value={member.id}>{member.name}</option>
                ))}
              </select>
            </label>
            <div className="flex justify-end mt-4">
              <button
                className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 mr-2"
                onClick={handleIssuing}
                disabled={!selectedMember}
              >
                Save
              </button>
              <button
                className="bg-gray-300 text-gray-700 py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-gray-400"
                onClick={closeIssuingModal}
              >
                Cancel
              </button>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default BookList;

    In this code, the background color of the book cards is set to dark blue (bg-blue-900), and the text color is white (text-white).

        {/* ... */}

      {/* ... */}

};

    Certainly! To change the header theme, you can modify the CSS classes and colors in the Header component. Here's an example of how you can update the header theme to use a different background color and text color:

    jsx
    import React from 'react';
import { Link } from 'react-router-dom';

const Header = () => {
  return (
    <header className="bg-blue-900 text-white p-4 sticky top-0">
      <div className="container mx-auto">
        <Link to="/">
          <h1 className="text-2xl font-semibold">Library Management System</h1>
        </Link>
      </div>
      <nav className="container mx-auto">
        <ul className="flex justify-center space-x-6">
          <li>
            <Link
              to="/books"
              className="text-white hover:text-blue-300 transition duration-300"
            >
              Books
            </Link>
          </li>
          <li>
            <Link
              to="/members"
              className="text-white hover:text-blue-300 transition duration-300"
            >
              Members
            </Link>
          </li>
          <li>
            <Link
              to="/import-books"
              className="text-white hover:text-blue-300 transition duration-300"
            >
              Import Books
            </Link>
          </li>
        </ul>

    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import axios from 'axios'; // const MemberCard = ({ member, onDeleteMember, onUpdateMember }) => { const MemberCard = ({ member, onDeleteMember, onUpdateMember }) => { const [isEditing, setIsEditing] = useState(false); const [updatedName, setUpdatedName] = useState(member.name); const [updatedAmountDue, setUpdatedAmountDue] = useState(member.amountdue); const [transactions, setTransactions] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { fetchTransactions(); }, []); const fetchTransactions = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/transactions/'); const memberTransactions = response.data.filter( transaction => transaction.member === member.id ); // Fetch book details for each transaction const transactionsWithBookNames = await Promise.all(memberTransactions.map(async transaction => { const bookResponse = await axios.get(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${transaction.book}/`); return { ...transaction, book_name: bookResponse.data.title // Assuming your book model has a "title" field }; })); setTransactions(transactionsWithBookNames); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching transactions:', error); } }; const handleUpdateClick = () => { setIsEditing(true); }; const handleCancelUpdate = () => { setIsEditing(false); setUpdatedName(member.name); setUpdatedAmountDue(member.amountdue); }; const handleUpdate = () => { onUpdateMember({ ...member, name: updatedName, amountdue: updatedAmountDue }); setIsEditing(false); }; const handleReturnBook = async (transactionId) => { const returnDate = new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 10); // Today's date try { const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/return-book/', { transaction_id: transactionId, return_date: returnDate, }); // Update the transactions after returning the book fetchTransactions(); } catch (error) { console.error('Error returning book:', error); } }; return ( <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md p-6 mb-4"> <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-2"> {isEditing ? ( <input type="text" value={updatedName} onChange={(e) => setUpdatedName(e.target.value)} style={{ outline: '2px solid blue' }} /> ) : ( member.name )} </h3> <p className="text-gray-600">Amount Due: {isEditing ? ( <input type="number" value={updatedAmountDue} onChange={(e) => setUpdatedAmountDue(e.target.value)} style={{ outline: '2px solid blue' }} /> ) : ( member.amountdue )} </p> <div className="mt-4 flex justify-end"> {isEditing ? ( <div> <button className="bg-green-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-green-600" onClick={handleUpdate} > Save </button> <button className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600 ml-2" onClick={handleCancelUpdate} > Cancel </button> </div> ) : ( <div> <button className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 mr-2" onClick={handleUpdateClick} > Update </button> <button className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600" onClick={() => onDeleteMember(member.id)} > Delete </button> </div> )} </div> <div className="mt-4"> <h4 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">Books Issued and Transactions:</h4> {transactions.length > 0 ? ( <table className="table-auto w-full"> <thead> <tr> <th className="px-4 py-2">Book Name</th> <th className="px-4 py-2">Issue Date</th> <th className="px-4 py-2">Return Date</th> <th className="px-4 py-2">Actions</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> {transactions.map(transaction => ( <tr key={transaction.id}> <td className="px-4 py-2">{transaction.book_name}</td> <td className="px-4 py-2">{transaction.issue_date}</td> <td className="px-4 py-2"> {transaction.return_date || 'Not returned'} </td> <td className="px-4 py-2"> {!transaction.return_date && ( <button className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-1 px-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-900" onClick={() => handleReturnBook(transaction.id)} > Return Book </button> )} </td> </tr> ))} </tbody> </table> ) : ( <p>No books issued</p> )} </div> </div> ); }; // return ( // <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md p-6 mb-4"> // <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-2"> // {isEditing ? }; export default MemberList; cahnge the backround to dark blue

    import React, { useState } from 'react'; import axios from 'axios'; const MemberForm = () => { const [transactionId, setTransactionId] = useState(''); const [returnDate, setReturnDate] = useState(new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]); const handleReturn = async () => { try { const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/return-book/', { transaction_id: transactionId, return_date: returnDate, }); console.log('Book returned:', response.data); // Reset form setTransactionId(''); setReturnDate(new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]); } catch (error) { console.error('Error returning book:', error); } }; return ( <div className="mt-4"> <div className="space-y-4"> <div> <label htmlFor="transactionId" className="block font-medium text-gray-700"> Transaction ID: </label> <input id="transactionId" type="number" className="mt-1 block w-full border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm focus:border-teal-400 focus:ring focus:ring-teal-200 focus:ring-opacity-50" value={transactionId} onChange={e => setTransactionId(e.target.value)} /> </div> <div> <label htmlFor="returnDate" className="block font-medium text-gray-700"> Return Date: </label> <input id="returnDate" type="date" className="mt-1 block w-full border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm focus:border-teal-400 focus:ring focus:ring-teal-200 focus:ring-opacity-50" value={returnDate} onChange={e => setReturnDate(e.target.value)} /> </div> <button onClick={handleReturn} className="bg-teal-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded-md hover:bg-teal-600 focus:outline-none focus:ring focus:ring-teal-200 focus:ring-opacity-50" > Return </button> </div> </div> ); }; export default MemberForm; cahnge the bacground colour to black
    1 / 1

    Certainly! Here's the updated code for the MemberForm component with the background color changed to black:

    jsx
    import React, { useState } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

const MemberForm = () => {
  const [transactionId, setTransactionId] = useState('');
  const [returnDate, setReturnDate] = useState(new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]);

  const handleReturn = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/return-book/', {
        transaction_id: transactionId,
        return_date: returnDate,
      });
      console.log('Book returned:', response.data);
      // Reset form
      setTransactionId('');
      setReturnDate(new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error returning book:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="mt-4 bg-black p-6 rounded-md">
      <div className="space-y-4">
        <div>
          <label htmlFor="transactionId" className="block font-medium text-white">
            Transaction ID:
          </label>
          <input
            id="transactionId"
            type="number"
            className="mt-1 block w-full border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm focus:border-teal-400 focus:ring focus:ring-teal-200 focus:ring-opacity-50"
            value={transactionId}
            onChange={e => setTransactionId(e.target.value)}
          />
        </div>
        <div>
          <label htmlFor="returnDate" className="block font-medium text-white">
            Return Date:
          </label>
          <input
            id="returnDate"
            type="date"
            className="mt-1 block w-full border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm focus:border-teal-400 focus:ring focus:ring-teal-200 focus:ring-opacity-50"
            value={returnDate}
            onChange={e => setReturnDate(e.target.value)}
          />
        </div>
        <button
          onClick={handleReturn}
          className="bg-teal-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded-md hover:bg-teal-600 focus:outline-none focus:ring focus:ring-teal-200 focus:ring-opacity-50"
        >
          Return
        </button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default MemberForm;

    I've updated the bg-black class in the outer div to change the background color of the component to black.

( <div> <button className="bg-green-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-green-600" onClick={handleUpdate} > Save </button> <button className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600 ml-2" onClick={handleCancelUpdate} > Cancel </button> </div> ) : ( <div> <button className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 mr-2" onClick={handleUpdateClick} > Update </button> <button className="bg-red-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-red-600" onClick={() => onDeleteMember(member.id)} > Delete </button> </div> )} </div> <div className="mt-4"> <h4 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">Books Issued and Transactions:</h4> {transactions.length > 0 ? ( <table className="table-auto w-full"> <thead> <tr> <th className="px-4 py-2">Book Name</th> <th className="px-4 py-2">Issue Date</th> <th className="px-4 py-2">Return Date</th> <th className="px-4 py-2">Actions</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> {transactions.map(transaction => ( <tr key={transaction.id}> <td className="px-4 py-2">{transaction.book_name}</td> <td className="px-4 py-2">{transaction.issue_date}</td> <td className="px-4 py-2"> {transaction.return_date || 'Not returned'} </td> <td className="px-4 py-2"> {!transaction.return_date && ( <button className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-1 px-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-900" onClick={() => handleReturnBook(transaction.id)} > Return Book </button> )} </td> </tr> ))} </tbody> </table> ) : ( <p>No books issued</p> )} </div> </div> ); }; const MemberList = () => { const [members, setMembers] = useState([]); const [newMemberName, setNewMemberName] = useState(''); const [newMemberAmountDue, setNewMemberAmountDue] = useState(''); useEffect(() => { fetchMembers(); }, []); const fetchMembers = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/'); const membersWithIssuedBooks = await Promise.all(response.data.map(async member => { const issuedBooksResponse = await Promise.all(member.books_issued.map(async bookId => { const bookResponse = await axios.get(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`); console.log('bookResponse:', bookResponse.data); return bookResponse.data; })); return { ...member, issuedBooks: issuedBooksResponse }; })); setMembers(membersWithIssuedBooks); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching members:', error); } }; const deleteMember = async (memberId) => { try { await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/${memberId}/`); fetchMembers(); } catch (error) { console.error('Error deleting member:', error); } }; const updateMember = async (updatedMember) => { try { await axios.put( `https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/${updatedMember.id}/`, updatedMember ); fetchMembers(); } catch (error) { console.error('Error updating member:', error); } }; const addMember = async () => { try { await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/', { name: newMemberName, amountdue: newMemberAmountDue, }); fetchMembers(); setNewMemberName(''); setNewMemberAmountDue(''); } catch (error) { console.error('Error adding member:', error); } }; return ( <div className="container mx-auto py-8"> <div className="mb-4"> <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-2">Add New Member</h2> <div className="flex"> <input type="text" className="border rounded-l p-2 w-1/2" placeholder="Name" value={newMemberName} onChange={(e) => setNewMemberName(e.target.value)} /> <input type="number" className="border rounded-r p-2 w-1/2" placeholder="Amount Due" value={newMemberAmountDue} onChange={(e) => setNewMemberAmountDue(e.target.value)} /> <button className="bg-green-500 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-green-600 ml-2" onClick={addMember} > Add </button> </div> </div> <div> {members.map(member => ( <MemberCard key={member.id} member={member} onDeleteMember={deleteMember} onUpdateMember={updateMember} /> ))} </div> </div> );     Sure, I've updated the code to change the background color of the card to blue. Here's the updated code:

    jsx
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

const MemberCard = ({ member, onDeleteMember, onUpdateMember }) => {
  const [isEditing, setIsEditing] = useState(false);
  const [updatedName, setUpdatedName] = useState(member.name);
  const [updatedAmountDue, setUpdatedAmountDue] = useState(member.amountdue);
  const [transactions, setTransactions] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchTransactions();
  }, []);

  const fetchTransactions = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/transactions/');
      const memberTransactions = response.data.filter(
        transaction => transaction.member === member.id
      );

      // Fetch book details for each transaction
      const transactionsWithBookNames = await Promise.all(memberTransactions.map(async transaction => {
        const bookResponse = await axios.get(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${transaction.book}/`);
        return {
          ...transaction,
          book_name: bookResponse.data.title // Assuming your book model has a "title" field
        };
      }));

      setTransactions(transactionsWithBookNames);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching transactions:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleUpdateClick = () => {
    setIsEditing(true);
  };

  const handleCancelUpdate = () => {
    setIsEditing(false);
    setUpdatedName(member.name);
    setUpdatedAmountDue(member.amountdue);
  };

  const handleUpdate = () => {
    onUpdateMember({ ...member, name: updatedName, amountdue: updatedAmountDue });
    setIsEditing(false);
  };

  const handleReturnBook = async (transactionId) => {
    const returnDate = new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 10); // Today's date
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/return-book/', {
        transaction_id: transactionId,
        return_date: returnDate,
      });
      // Update the transactions after returning the book
      fetchTransactions();
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error returning book:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-blue-500 rounded-lg shadow-md p-6 mb-4">
      {/* Rest of your code */}
      {/* ... */}
    </div>
  );
};

    To set a background image for the page, you can use CSS to apply the background image to the outermost div element. Here's an example of how you can do that:

    jsx
    import React from 'react';
import MemberList from '../components/MemberList';

const MembersPage = () => {
  const backgroundImageUrl = 'url(your-background-image-url.jpg)'; // Replace with your image URL

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen" style={{ backgroundImage: backgroundImageUrl, backgroundSize: 'cover' }}>
      <div className="max-w-6xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
        <h2 className="text-2xl font-semibold mb-4 text-white">Member List</h2>
        <div className="bg-white shadow overflow-hidden rounded-lg">
          <div className="px-4 py-5 sm:p-6">
            <MemberList />
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default MembersPage;

    Replace 'your-background-image-url.jpg' with the actual URL of your background image. This code sets the background image, adjusts the background size to cover the entire element, and maintains the rest of the structure from the previous code snippet.

    To add a background image to the BooksPage component, you can apply the background image to the outermost div element. Here's how you can modify your code:

    jsx
    import React from 'react';
import BookList from '../components/BookList';
import backgroundImage from '../images/bg1.jpeg';

const BooksPage = () => {
  const divStyle = {
    backgroundImage: `url(${backgroundImage})`,
    backgroundSize: 'cover',
    minHeight: '100vh',
    padding: '12px 4px',
  };

  return (
    <div style={divStyle}>
      <div className="max-w-7xl mx-auto sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
        <div className="bg-black overflow-hidden shadow-xl rounded-lg p-6 text-white">
          <h2 className="text-2xl font-semibold mb-4">Book List</h2>

    1 / 1
    set bckground image by the height and width of the screen
    1 / 1

    To set the background image to cover the entire screen, you can use the CSS property backgroundSize set to 100% 100% or cover. Here's how you can modify your code to achieve this:

    jsx
    import React from 'react';
import BookList from '../components/BookList';
import backgroundImage from '../images/bg1.jpeg'; 

const BooksPage = () => {
  const divStyle = {
    backgroundImage: `url(${backgroundImage})`,
    backgroundSize: 'cover', // Set background size to cover the entire element
    minHeight: '100vh', // Set the minimum height to the height of the viewport
    minWidth: '100vw', // Set the minimum width to the width of the viewport
    padding: '12px 4px',
  };

  return (
    <div style={divStyle}>
      <div className="max-w-7xl mx-auto sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
        <div className="bg-black overflow-hidden shadow-xl rounded-lg p-6 text-white">
          <h2 className="text-2xl font-semibold mb-4">Book List</h2>
          <BookList />
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BooksPage;

    By setting backgroundSize to cover, the background image will be scaled to cover the entire element while maintaining its aspect ratio. The minHeight and minWidth are set to 100vh and 100vw, respectively, which ensures that the background image covers the entire viewport.

    1 / 1
    set background image in fix position
    1 / 1

    To set a background image in a fixed position, you can use the CSS property backgroundAttachment set to fixed. Here's how you can modify your code to achieve this:

    jsx
    import React from 'react';
import BookList from '../components/BookList';
import backgroundImage from '../images/bg1.jpeg'; 

const BooksPage = () => {
  const divStyle = {
    backgroundImage: `url(${backgroundImage})`,
    backgroundSize: 'cover', // Set background size to cover the entire element
    backgroundAttachment: 'fixed', // Set background attachment to fixed
    minHeight: '100vh', // Set the minimum height to the height of the viewport
    minWidth: '100vw', // Set the minimum width to the width of the viewport
    padding: '12px 4px',
  };

  return (
    <div style={divStyle}>
      <div className="max-w-7xl mx-auto sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
        <div className="bg-black bg-opacity-75 overflow-hidden shadow-xl rounded-lg p-6 text-white">
          <h2 className="text-2xl font-semibold mb-4">Book List</h2>

        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

    By setting backgroundAttachment to fixed, the background image will remain fixed while the content scrolls over it.     1 / 1
    import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import axios from 'axios'; const BookList = () => { const [books, setBooks] = useState([]); const [selectedBook, setSelectedBook] = useState(null); const [selectedMember, setSelectedMember] = useState(''); const [members, setMembers] = useState([]); const [isIssuingModalOpen, setIsIssuingModalOpen] = useState(false); const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState(''); useEffect(() => { fetchBooks(); fetchMembers(); }, []); const fetchBooks = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/'); setBooks(response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching books:', error); } }; const fetchMembers = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/members/'); setMembers(response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching members:', error); } }; const openIssuingModal = (book) => { setSelectedBook(book); setSelectedMember(''); setIsIssuingModalOpen(true); }; const closeIssuingModal = () => { setSelectedBook(null); setSelectedMember(''); setIsIssuingModalOpen(false); }; const handleIssuing = async () => { try { const response = await axios.post('https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/issue-book/', { book: selectedBook.id, member: selectedMember, issue_date: new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0], }); closeIssuingModal(); fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list } catch (error) { console.error('Error issuing book:', error); } }; const handleDeleteBook = async (bookId) => { try { await axios.delete(`https://12niraj01.pythonanywhere.com/api/books/${bookId}/`); fetchBooks(); // Refresh book list } catch (error) { console.error('Error deleting book:', error); } }; const handleSearch = () => { if (searchQuery.trim() === '') { fetchBooks(); // Reset the list if the search query is empty } else { const filteredBooks = books.filter(book => book.title.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase()) || book.authors.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase()) ); setBooks(filteredBooks); } }; return ( <div className="p-4"> {/* Search Bar */} <div className="mb-4 flex justify-center items-center"> <input type="text" placeholder="Search by title or author" className="border rounded w-full p-2" value={searchQuery} onChange={e => setSearchQuery(e.target.value)} /> <button className="bg-gray-700 text-white py-2 px-4 rounded hover:bg-blue-900 ml-2" onClick={handleSearch} > Search </button> </div> {/* Render book cards */} <div className="grid gap-4"> {books.map(book => ( <div key={book.id} className="bg-blue-900 p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md border border-gray-300 text-white"> <h3 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">{book.title}</h3> <p className="text-gray-400">Author: {book.authors}</p> <p className="text-gray-400">ISBN: {book.isbn}</p> <p className="text-gray-400">Average
